notes: The evidence provided does not contain any explicit normative wording or mathematical relation between the fields t-Reassembly and t-StatusProhibit within the same IE. Both fields are mentioned in the context of timers, but no direct semantic constraint is established between them.

meta.evidence:
This timer is used by the receiving side of an AM RLC entity and receiving UM RLC entity in order to detect loss of RLC PDUs at lower layer (see sub clauses 5.2.2.2 and 5.2.3.2). If t -Reassembly is running, t -Reassembly shall not be started additionally, i.e. only one t -Reassembly per RLC entity is running at a given time. c) t -StatusProhibit
